meanings.definition: To make something neat or tidy.
meanings.sent1: She was redding up her room before her friends came over.
meanings.sent2: I always redding up my desk before starting work.
meanings.sent3: He was redding up the mess of papers on his desk, looking like a busy bee.
meanings.sent4: The gardener was redding up the flower beds, turning chaos into order.
meanings.sent5: The magic wand redding up the room in an instant, like a whirlwind of cleanliness.

meanings.definition: The act of getting something ready or prepared.
meanings.sent1: The redding of the stage for the play took hours of hard work.
meanings.sent2: She did the redding for the party, making sure everything was perfect.
meanings.sent3: The redding of the picnic area was a team effort, with everyone pitching in.
meanings.sent4: The redding of the equipment before the game was crucial for the team's success.
meanings.sent5: The redding of the house for the guests involved fresh flowers and clean linens.
